DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Diagnostic Imaging Baseline Assessment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, being used to assess or evaluate at starting point to which things may be compared.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Diagnostic Imaging Baseline Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body, a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis, being used to assess or evaluate at starting point to which things may be compared.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
